title: Example: Monorepo Build Orchestration
description: Create working example showing parallel package builds with caching for monorepo scenario
close_reason:
✅ Fixed critical dependency execution bug and completed working monorepo example

CRITICAL FIX IMPLEMENTED:
- gaffer-exec was NOT executing dependencies declared in 'deps' field for atomic graphs  
- Added expand_atomic_graph_with_deps() to detect and expand atomic graphs with deps into composites
- Dependencies now execute in correct topological order before main commands
- Tested: rm -rf packages/*/dist && gaffer-exec run start → all packages build, app runs successfully

ISSUES RESOLVED:
1. ✅ Dependencies execute transitively (clean → shared-lib → services → gateway → web-app → build-all → start)
2. ✅ Build artifacts (dist folders) created before use  
3. ✅ Test assertions fixed (packages vs services, web-app vs shared-lib)
4. ✅ Example works end-to-end as documented

COMMITS:
- gaffer: 8d37b9e fix(gaffer-exec): execute dependencies for atomic graphs with deps
- gaffer-public: 32bb8bf fix(examples): correct test assertions, merged to main

All tests pass. Example demonstrates real-world TypeScript monorepo builds with parallel execution.

title: Create verifiable examples for all gaffer-exec use cases
description:
Create WORKING, EXECUTABLE examples for all gaffer-exec use cases documented in docs/gaffer-exec-use-cases.md.

**CRITICAL REQUIREMENTS:**
1. Each example MUST use a known, popular open source project (not toy/mock code)
2. Each example MUST have a graph.json file that can be executed with gaffer-exec
3. Each example MUST have actual executable scripts/code (not just documentation)
4. Users MUST be able to run 'gaffer-exec run <task>' and see it work
5. Include README explaining what the example demonstrates and how to run it
6. Examples MUST be placed in hedinfaok/gaffer-public repository under examples/ directory

**Definition of Done per example:**
- Uses real open source project (document how to clone/setup)
- graph.json exists and validates
- Tasks defined in graph.json can be executed successfully
- At least one runnable command demonstrated (e.g., gaffer-exec run build)
- README documents what command to run and expected output
- Example demonstrates core value proposition of use case
- Setup instructions include any git clone/version requirements

**NOT acceptable:**
- Toy/mock examples
- Documentation-only exa- Documentation-only exa-not be executed
- Examples without graph.json files
